course_description: This course will examine legal issues relating to the formation, terms, performance, and enforcement of contracts for the sale of goods pursuant to Article 2 of the Uniform Commercial Code (the "UCC"). Every state other than Louisiana, the District of Columbia, and the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico have adopted  UCC Article 2. Topics covered in the course will include (1) the scope of UCC Article 2, (2) the formation of contracts for the sale of goods, (3) statute of frauds, (4) the parol evidence rule, (5) warranties, (6)  defenses to performance, and (7) nonmonetary and monetary remedies for breach of contract.
